children.subject: Yes. Fixed.
Should the title read "Lower Div Courses"?
You need to log in using your berkeley.edu address.
can't access the google form

I just realize my last question doesn't make sense. Instead, could you give us a live update or two during Phase 1 on currently registered number? This would give us an idea of whether or not to actually use those four units.

What the post is saying is that EE 16A Enrolment will also be highly competitive. The post does mention that if there are additional applicants in Phase 2, they will be considered if there are seats left. In summary, think of EE 16A as one of the highly competitive courses.

Thank you for your comments. I certainly understand that EE 20 and 40 have never been phase 1 courses in the past. They've also never been in their final term of being offered, which is making them in higher demand. This is why we wanted to alert you. :) We will do our best to accommodate everyone who needs the course, but we recognize that folks who need both in the sequence (and (those who are graduating) must be prioritized. This is the reason for the google form. If you are a graduating LSCS major, please indicate that in your form. If it is not your last term, you can certainly still apply and put the course in phase 2. If there is space, great. If not, you'll have another opportunity to take EE16A when it is larger in Spring 15. You are welcome to reach out to me or Sara Nevius at any time to ask about progress on the course. Feel free to let me know if you have other questions!

Thanks, Sarah.

One simple question: between (a) graduating senior who needs EE20 in Fall 2015 but who only added the class during phase 2, (b) non-graduating student who added the class during phase 1:

which group of people would be given higher priority at the beginning of phase 2?

I'm not sure I understand the question. Graduating seniors and folks who need to finish out the sequence will be moved in after phase 1, as I've mentioned. Anyone who adds in phase 2 is doing so at their own risk. If graduating seniors add in phase 2, we will try to accommodate them, but there are no guarantees as we cannot predict how many seats there will be. Hope this helps, let me know if I missed something.

I think the policy is unreasonable for CS majors who need one of EE20 and EE40 during their last semester.

Specifically, I don't want to spend 4 valuable Phase 1 units on EE20 just to place myself on the waitlist, since these four units might be spent on a more packed CS class.

Could you reconsider this policy? 

Otherwise, could you give us an estimate of how many people will *need* EE20 during Fall 2015?

What the post is saying is that EE 16A Enrolment will also be highly competitive. The post does mention that if there are additional applicants in Phase 2, they will be considered if there are seats left. In summary, think of EE 16A as one of the highly competitive courses.

EE20 or 40. If you need one of these courses to finish the sequence, you must fill out the google form, AND place yourself on the TeleBEARS waitlist by the end of phase 1 to be considered. I am referring to EE 20 or 40, not EE 16A.

Sorry, I meant EE 20/40. From above: "We will manually enroll those who need to finish the sequence at the end of phase 1. If there is remaining space after phase 1, we will consider additional applicants. "

Thank you for your comments. I certainly understand that EE 20 and 40 have never been phase 1 courses in the past. They've also never been in their final term of being offered, which is making them in higher demand. This is why we wanted to alert you. :) We will do our best to accommodate everyone who needs the course, but we recognize that folks who need both in the sequence (and (those who are graduating) must be prioritized. This is the reason for the google form. If you are a graduating LSCS major, please indicate that in your form. If it is not your last term, you can certainly still apply and put the course in phase 2. If there is space, great. If not, you'll have another opportunity to take EE16A when it is larger in Spring 15. Feel free to let me know if you have other questions!

I think so too. In previous semester, students can enroll in EE 20 or EE 40 in phase two. I do not want to waste the valuable Phase 1 units to be added in the EE 20 or 40, given the highly competitive CS course enrollment.

Hello- we expect that Spring 16 will be a regular Telebears enrollment process with no google application. So that means priority will go to whoever has registration priority. However, if you are EECS and need BOTH EE 16A/B to graduate, you should apply in Fall 15 and indicate this on your application.

Hi Sarah,

Will graduating seniors have priority to take EE16A in Spring 2016?

This is a concern because all the people who need the EE requirement will want to take it. I will be graduating and have been holding on and waiting for the new EE16A to come out. I wanted to take it this spring, but was dropped off the waitlist around the 2nd week and would not like to take it in the Fall because of other classes.

Hello- you can certainly apply for both and indicate why you need them in the application. We cannot guarantee anything but will do our best to accommodate anyone who needs them!

Thanks!

Sarah

Hi Sarah,

I am currently a 2nd year EECS student and want to try and take ee20 and ee40 both next semester since I feel like I've limited myself to cs classes and if I don't take them both at the same time, I won't be able to take an ee upper division course until my senior year. Would it be possible for me to take both or would I have to take ee 16a/16b in a sequence instead? Thanks!
Yes.
To clarify- you're welcome to phase 2 it, at your own risk. We are suggesting that folks who really need it put it in phase 1 because we expect demand to be higher than in previous terms.

Just to clarify,

I am an EECS sophomore and need to take EE40 in the fall. I have to phase 1 this class and lose 4 units of phase 1 space for CS upper-divs?

history.content:
Update as of 4:50, 4/6/15:

Dear Students-

Thank you for all of your feedback regarding the EE lower division enrollment policies I outlined on Friday. We have heard your concerns. I would like to share with you a slight modification to the lower division EE enrollment procedures. 
Regarding EE 20 and EE 40: If you are in one of the following groups, we will reserve a seat for you:
- Students who have taken 20 but not 40 (or vice-versa)
- Students who need 20 or 40 and are graduating in Fall 15 or Spring 16
If you are in one of the above listed categories, please add your name to the appropriate google application form. I will be reviewing these application forms tomorrow morning (4/7/15) and will notify you if a seat has been reserved for you. If you are contacted by the end of business tomorrow, you may reallocate your Phase 1 units to something else. Google forms are below (you must use your berkeley.edu address to log in): 
EE 40 application form
EE 20 application form
If you are not in one of the groups I listed above, and you really want to take EE 20 and/or 40, you may still wish to use phase 1 units. Because this is the last offering of these courses, we expect demand to be higher than in previous terms, however, we do not have a full understanding of the number of students who intend to take these courses. As always, we will do our best to accommodate as many students as possible. If you would prefer to use your phase 2 units, you may do so, but please note that unless you are in one of the previously mentioned groups, we cannot guarantee you a spot in phase 2. 
*Important* We still expect EE16A to be a highly impacted course. If you plan to take EE 16A, you should still consider using your phase 1 units. 
I hope this helps clarify matters.
Warm regards,
Sarah

Dear Students;

With the last offering of EE 20 and 40 in Fall 15, we will be using some different enrollment procedures to ensure that those who need to finish the sequence get first priority in these courses. Please read the following carefully so you understand how to maximize your Phase 1 and Phase 2 options. 
  • EE 20 and 40 will be using a google form application process. If you need one of these courses to finish the sequence, you must fill out the google form, AND place yourself on the TeleBEARS waitlist by the end of phase 1 to be considered. For this reason, enrollment capacity in EE 20 and 40 is currently set to zero. We will manually enroll those who need to finish the sequence at the end of phase 1. If there is remaining space after phase 1, we will consider additional applicants. Application forms can be found below.
  • EE 20 application: http://goo.gl/forms/yMXwPsh3Zy
  • EE 40 application: http://goo.gl/forms/bjVHiOSRmk
  • EE 16A will use a regular TeleBEARS process to enroll. We expect that demand for this course will be extremely high. We are recommending that any student who wants to take this class should add it in Phase 1. Please note that during this especially impacted semester, some seats will be reserved for incoming first-year students, as well as some seats for EECS and declared CS sophomores, juniors, and seniors.
  • Enrollment for EE 16B is only available to those who have taken EE 16A during Spring 2015. For this reason, enrollment capacity is currently set to zero. If you plan to take EE16B, you may add yourself to the TeleBEARS waitlist in Phase 2. We will manually enroll those who have taken EE 16A. 
Please feel free to contact Sarah Van Nostrand or Sara Nevius with questions about this. We're also available for drop-in questions in 203/205 Cory Hall. 
Warm regards,
Sarah
history.subject: Enrollment Procedures for EE Lower Div Courses in Fall 15 *Important*

history.content:
Dear Students;

With the last offering of EE 20 and 40 in Fall 15, we will be using some different enrollment procedures to ensure that those who need to finish the sequence get first priority in these courses. Please read the following carefully so you understand how to maximize your Phase 1 and Phase 2 options. 
  • EE 20 and 40 will be using a google form application process. If you need one of these courses to finish the sequence, you must fill out the google form, AND place yourself on the TeleBEARS waitlist by the end of phase 1 to be considered. For this reason, enrollment capacity in EE 20 and 40 is currently set to zero. We will manually enroll those who need to finish the sequence at the end of phase 1. If there is remaining space after phase 1, we will consider additional applicants. Application forms can be found below.
  • EE 20 application: http://goo.gl/forms/yMXwPsh3Zy
  • EE 40 application: http://goo.gl/forms/bjVHiOSRmk
  • EE 16A will use a regular TeleBEARS process to enroll. We expect that demand for this course will be extremely high. We are recommending that any student who wants to take this class should add it in Phase 1. Please note that during this especially impacted semester, some seats will be reserved for incoming first-year students, as well as some seats for EECS and declared CS sophomores, juniors, and seniors.
  • Enrollment for EE 16B is only available to those who have taken EE 16A during Spring 2015. For this reason, enrollment capacity is currently set to zero. If you plan to take EE16B, you may add yourself to the TeleBEARS waitlist in Phase 2. We will manually enroll those who have taken EE 16A. 
Please feel free to contact Sarah Van Nostrand or Sara Nevius with questions about this. We're also available for drop-in questions in 203/205 Cory Hall. 
Warm regards,
Sarah
